summary: This is an email from attorney Jeanne M. Christensen to an unspecified recipient, discussing potential evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It references a video allegedly showing a victim being forced to have sex with multiple men at a hotel, names of men involved, and contemporaneous journals containing content about Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Author of the email, a partner at Wigdor LLP, providing information about potential evidence including a video and journals related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE', mentioned in contemporaneous journals and likely known by men involved in the alleged video incident.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'GM', mentioned in contemporaneous journals alongside Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Mentioned as having a former friend who was one of the men involved in the alleged video incident with a victim.

connections.description: Both are mentioned together in contemporaneous journals discussed in the email.
Leon Black is described as having a former friend who was one of the men involved in the alleged video incident.
The email states that the former friend of Leon Black 'likely knew JE' (Jeffrey Epstein).

events.title: Alleged hotel video incident
events.description: A victim was allegedly videotaped at a hotel being forced to have sex with three out of six men present.
personsInvolved: Unnamed former friend of Leon Black

events.title: Email correspondence regarding evidence
events.description: Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen sends an email discussing potential evidence including a video and journals related to Epstein and Maxwell.

locations.context: Office address of Jeanne M. Christensen, partner at Wigdor LLP.
Unspecified hotel where the alleged video incident took place.

keyFacts: The email references an alleged video circulating on a 'disgusting sex site' showing a victim being forced to have sex with three men at a hotel, with six men total present.
One of the men involved is identified as a former friend of Leon Black, and it is suggested that both this man and another likely knew Jeffrey Epstein.
The email mentions the existence of contemporaneous journals containing 'a lot of content about JE and GM' (Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell).
The victim was allegedly contacted 'randomly' by a gamer who claimed to have seen a video matching her description, leading to a screenshot of that conversation.
The communication is from attorney Jeanne M. Christensen of Wigdor LLP, indicating legal investigation or representation related to these allegations.
